name: dylan's beanie
notes:
**i'm unable to offer pattern support for my free patterns via ravelry pm or email - please visit the [wormhead's hats group][1] if you have a question about this pattern. thanks for your understanding!**
  [1]: https://www.ravelry.com/discuss/woolly-wormheads-hats/3087128/1-25#10

one of the great things about being a traveller is that you help people out - you trade skills or items or just do ‘stuff’ as a favour. it's how commune living works. money is tight and time has the higher value, so any amount of help is always appreciated and returned.

a friend gave us some great items for our wee baba aran when we were in holland, and in return i gifted hats for her two children. her daughter was easy - i had a big bag of suitable hats, however her son was more difficult.

so i knitted him a beanie, this beanie. 

this is a top down ribbed beanie, with notes for adapting for different sizes and gauges. ideal for adding stripes or a brim. a great, quick knit for the men folk!

**yarn** 
110-220yd/100-201m/50-100g heavy dk or worsted weight, multi-plied yarn 

**needles & notions** 
set 4mm/uk8/us6 dpns/circular or size needed to obtain gauge
stitch marker as necessary
tapestry needle 

**gauge** 
20 sts x 28 rows to 4in/10cm on 4mm needles over st.st. 

**sizes** 
to fit sizes: 15 (18, 20, 23) in/38 (46, 51, 58.5) cm
finished size: 12 (14.5, 17, 19.5) in/ 30.5 (37, 43, 49.5) cm 

**sample details** 
shown in little houndales knits yorkshire wolds suffolk x (220yd/201m per 100g; 100% wool) 
shown in size 23in/58.5cm on model with 23in/58.5cm circumference head 

**skills required** 
knit & purl sts, knitting in the round, increases & decreases, circular cast-on, elastic bind-off

**accessibility statement**
the main pdf for this pattern is colour blind accessible. it uses black text on a white background and does not rely on colour.

published 2008
